glsa.title: uw-imap: Remote buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: uw-imap is vulnerable to remote overflow of a buffer in the IMAP server leading to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: uw-imap is the University of Washington's IMAP and POP server daemons.

description.p: Improper bounds checking of user supplied data while parsing IMAP mailbox names can lead to overflowing the stack buffer.

impact.p: Successful exploitation requires an authenticated IMAP user to request a malformed mailbox name. This can lead to execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the IMAP server.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds at this time.

resolution.p: All uw-imap users should upgrade to the latest version:
